answers.answer: Oh gosh. Try not to go looking for trouble. Stop testing him unless he's showing symptoms. You know what they are. Let him eat a normal diet and enjoy the fact that he doesn't have diabetes.

question: I have had diabetes for 18 years now and I am 31 years old. For the past two years now I have been taking my sons blood glucose every couple weeks. Most of the time his blood sugar is fine but once he got a blood sugar of 300, I quickly took him to the doctor and his A1c was at normal level. Should I restrict him from candy and sweets or follow a normal diet.
title: fear of type 1 diabetes
